WRITING.TITLE: About:config in Firefox Fenix, And now you can enable Dns-over-https

WRITING.TEXT: Why it's not enabled by default even in Fennec?
Is this power consuming just in Fennec or both

network.trr.mode it's 0 by default , so you have to change it to 2 and that's why, 0 - Default value in standard Firefox installations (currently is 5, which means DoH is disabled) 1 - DoH is enabled, but Firefox picks if it uses DoH or regular DNS based on which returns faster query responses 2 - DoH is enabled, and regular DNS works as a backup 3 - DoH is enabled, and regular DNS is disabled 5 - DoH is disabled A value of 2 works best.
Unfortunately no
Make sure you're using the latest nightly version
Actually I don't know exactly, but the app is getting better and better, enhanced tracking Protection is coming
This Firefox preview"fenix" not the regular Firefox for Android , still in progress you can test it by the way

WRITING.TEXT: @linux ~ gt; top MiB Mem : 7858.2 total, 1357.3 free, 1984.2 used, 4516.7 buff/cache. and @linux ~ gt; free -m total used free shared buff/cache available Mem: 7858 2316 958 523 4582 4714 Swap: 4095 0 4095

If you selected automatic partitioning and the I would like to make additional space available , or if there is not enough free space on your selected hard drives to install Fedora, the `Reclaim Space` dialog will appear. This dialog lists all disk devices you have configured and all partitions on those devices. The bottom right corner of the dialog displays information about how much space the system needs for at least a minimal installation and how much space you have reclaimed.

WRITING.TITLE: How to disable Pop Shop from Auto Start with the system
WRITING.TEXT: i really don't use pop shop that much and do my updates from terminal, would be nice to disable it
Pop shop doesn't appear in Startup application list

No i tried this but still run at startup i found the answer you should edit: /usr/share/applications/io.elementary.appcenter-daemon.desktop and put # here before this line : #Exec=io.elemantry.appcenter -s

WRITING.TITLE: WebRender is not working in FF 81 linux
WRITING.TEXT: `gfx.webrender.all` is `true` and Stuck on `Basic`, had this problem few days ago, I've removed FF and all config files and then did a reinstall, after fresh install i was able to switch to `WebRender` and all good, but today i've noticed that it goes back to Basic , Is there any bug in latest Version?? I'm on Pop\_OS Wayland Window Protocol: wayland/drm gpu : intel UHD 620 $ MOZ_LOG="PlatformDecoderModule:5" MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 firefox Child 9172: MediaPDecoder #1]: D/PlatformDecoderModule DMA-Buf/VA-API can't be used, WebRender/DMA-Buf is disabled [Child 9172: MediaPDecoder #1]: D/PlatformDecoderModule Initialising FFmpeg decoder. [Child 9172: MediaPDecoder #2]: D/PlatformDecoderModule AudioTrimmer[0x7f60b67fc3e0] ::Decode: sample[0,21000] no trimming information [Child 9172: MediaPDecoder #1]: D/PlatformDecoderModule FFmpeg init successful. [Child 9172: MediaPDecoder #2]: D/PlatformDecoderModule Choosing FFmpeg pixel format for video decoding. #8203; [https://bin.privacytools.io/?8827d93da171bb65#rvOJmucjMrAOhcPYzVcK23sR3jGFLLPXBiIHGmZWFXU=](https://bin.privacytools.io/?8827d93da171bb65#rvOJmucjMrAOhcPYzVcK23sR3jGFLLPXBiIHGmZWFXU=) EDIT: `gfx.xrender.enabled` set to `false` #1548; fix the problem https://preview.redd.it/s3bpcsr6lor51.png?width=1920 amp;format=png amp;auto=webp amp;s=f6da701f359d652cf7ebf46e18a19e9e76ebdedd
